Transformation.short_description: Fundamental change in the nature or structure of something.

Cycle.short_description: Recurring pattern of stages or phases returning to origin.

Evolution.short_description: Progressive development from simple to complex forms.

Involution.short_description: Process of manifestation from subtle to gross states.

Emergence.short_description: Arising of new properties or patterns from simpler components.

Dissolution.short_description: Breaking down of complex structures into simpler elements.

Flow.short_description: Continuous movement or transfer of energy/information.

Oscillation.short_description: Regular alternation between different states or poles.

Integration.short_description: Process of unifying separate elements into coherent whole.

Differentiation.short_description: Development of distinction and specialization from unity.

Recursion.short_description: Process that contains or generates copies of itself.

Transcendence.short_description: Movement beyond current limitations or conditions.

Emanation.short_description: Flowing forth from source to manifestation.

Entropy.short_description: Tendency toward increasing disorder or equilibrium.

Negentropy.short_description: Organization increasing in complexity against entropy.

Bifurcation.short_description: Division of one path into two distinct trajectories.

Morphogenesis.short_description: Development of form and structure in systems.

Phase Transition.short_description: Fundamental shift between different states or modes.

Polarization.short_description: Development of opposite qualities or tendencies.

Synthesis.short_description: Combination of elements into new unified whole.

Catalysis.short_description: Facilitation or acceleration of change processes.

Metamorphosis.short_description: Complete transformation of form or nature.

Iteration.short_description: Repeated application of process or operation.

Fragmentation.short_description: Breaking of unity into separate parts.

Turbulence.short_description: Complex, chaotic interaction of flows and forces.

Transmutation.short_description: Change in fundamental nature or substance.

Assimilation.short_description: Incorporation of external elements into system.

Dissipation.short_description: Gradual dispersal of energy or structure.

Convergence.short_description: Movement toward unity or common point.

Divergence.short_description: Movement away from common point toward diversity.

Recursion.short_description: Self-referential or nested repetition of process.

Emergence.short_description: Appearance of new properties from underlying processes.
